title: I see no reason to ever play Nocturne when Vi and Rengar exist
body:
And that's not a knock (or noc for the phreakish puns) on Rengar or Vi as champions. But the fact of the matter is, they do his job and do it significantly better than he does for a few reasons.

Let's start with Vi:

She has more durability
More upfront damage and good sustained damage, not to mention utility in the form of armor shred
Better ganking at basically all points of the game
Better clear in the jungle
Functions better as a bruiser/off-tank (keep in mind whenever nocturne has been played competitively, he's been built basically full tank + botrk)
Arguably, she scales better than Nocturne 

With Rengar, there's not a lot to say. Rengar is just a better version of nocturne when you build both to do damage, whereas Vi is better as a bruiser/off-tank and more reliable overall. 

Nocturne needs changes and I'm not sure buffing numbers changes much, unless you just overtune the crap out of him, which is not the way to go. He needs his role to be differentiated somehow. Paranoia is his bread and butter as a champion and the spell has a lot of power in it, given that it denies vision ontop of instant dive. But the fact remains he can seldom use the power of his dive. Obviously his E has a delay on it due to the simple fact it would be kind of silly if he could ult from such a range and instantly stun somebody, but Vi does this from a pretty respectable range, too. Minus the semi global range obviously. 

I'm not really sure what the answers are, but nocturne just kinda seems lackluster compared to those two. His spell shield is also a pretty weak defensive tool. And his base defensive stats are not good. And his passive is honestly kind of bleh.

I know sated devourer does help him some and is good on him but at it's core, it doesn't solve any of his problems. He just needs some power shifts I suspect, maybe a complete removal of his W and a new skill entirely or something. But either way, he definitely just feels pretty lackluster

And I've already touched base on how poor his defensive stats are whereas Rengar kills things quicker and gets access to armor/mr buffs and a heal and Vis passive and high base damages allow her to build heavy durability and still isolate a carry and potentially kill them.

I hear that argument a lot, that higher pick rates mean lower win rates. And yet it seems to be consistently untrue. Vayne's pickrate is 3 times what it was a few months ago and her win rate hasn't budged. Ahri's win rate and pick rate are both very, very high. Yasuo's pick and win rates have been on the rise for several patches. Riven has had both a high win rate and been extremely popular for ages. I buy the argument that a champ's win rate goes down when they become FOTM due to a swarm of people picking up the champion for the first time. But I don't buy that popularity alone has anything to do with win rate.  Vi and Rengar aren't FOTM, so I think it's fair to say their win rates a reasonable indicator of their strength in solo q. And right now, they're both worse than Nocturne, both when newbies play them and when mains play them.

Vayne is sitting at 34.93% right now, which is higher than all of those champions except Thresh. Lee Sin is at 15.99%, Riven is at 16.88%, and Yasuo is at 6.72%. She has the second highest play rate in the game right now.

His a very situational and niche pick in dire need of buffs. His playstyle is one of THE most unique in this game, he takes some skill to play since he doesn't have what one could call "traditional ganking tools", at least not untill he gets level 6 and unlocks his ultimate. And that's a problem. You are not mastering a champion based on their kit and its involvement around every possible situation, you're adjusting your playstyle to a champion that's lacking. You learn to play by being crippled from the start, instead of working your way up, not to mention there is no clear emphasis on counterpicking with or against him. Sadly, his fucking awesome eternum skin and great thematic are suffering because of it :/ .

My honest opinion is that he does indeed need a kit rework, not just buffs.
On top of my head, here are a couple of suggestions, with the notion of him being a jungler that comes from far away inside the jungle to assasinate a single target by ravaging him with abilities as well as basic attacks.

-Still builds AD. Now has a new passive. For the sake of doubt, let's name it "nocnoc, who's there". His basic attacks apply a debuf, that when consumed, give each of his abilities a special effect. Doesn't stack with itself, meaning you apply it, proc it with a spell, re-apply it, then proc it again. Could be instant, or with a very short cooldown if deemed overly excessive/oppressive when used on the same target(assassin or not, balance above all else). Kinda like Nautilus's passive but in a shorter cooldown so as to make sense with the rest of the kit. It can be applied on several enemies at a time.

-Remove his old passive. Turn it into his Q. Now he has a small AoE cleave spell ala Zed/Hecarim, that does physical damage. If it consumes "nocnoc, who's there" it does increased physical damage, to keep the identity of his "periodically enhanced basic attacks" since his Q is on a fairly low coodlown to be spammable and his main source of jungle clear.

-Remove his E, put it into his W as his secondary spell. Same effect as before, tether an enemy for magic damage, at the end fear them if the connection isn't     broken. If it consumes "nocnoc, who's there" it absorbes the target's health in a similar manner as Fiddlesticks's W, healing Nocturne for the duration. It's now his new form of sustain.

-His new E now is a projectile that works and feels like his old Q but with possibly a tad narrower hitbox. It's now his only ganking tool untill he gets level 6. Nocturne releases black haze that passes through all enemies hit dealing a rather small amount of damage. Why? Because this is now his only ganking tool before level 6. When the haze hits an enemy champion it dissolves dealing damage and slowing them. The longer it travels, the more its damage falls off but the greater the slow gets. As an incentive for players to land long range skillshots instead of free poke damage, they are rewarded with a very strong slow. It stops at the first champion hit. If it procs "nocnoc, who's there" it stuns instead of slowing, for a duration that's up for discussion.

-His ultimate can stay the same. But it does last a little bit longer, to emphasize the fear of drowning in darkness and isolation. With perhaps lesser cooldown, or maybe it gets its cooldown partialy lowered if you kill an enemy shortly after using it. But I have this idea: turn it into the exact opposite of TF's ult. Now it is global, Nocturne can jump to any enemy champion he wishes and could perhaps deal no damage to allocate powerbudget to the rest of his kit, to counteract his now global presense. Both of my iterations now apply "nocnoc, who's there" to all enemy champions.
